description: Calque of a Mande term, perhaps Vai [Term?] or Mandinka [Term?], which entered English via Gullah [Term?]. Compare Japanese 悪口(わるぐち) (waruguchi, “badmouthing”), which is a compound of 悪(わる) (waru, “bad, wicked”) and 口(くち) (kuchi, “mouth”).

verbs.description: badmouth (third-person singular simple present badmouths, present participle badmouthing, simple past and past participle badmouthed)

entries.meaning: (informal) To criticize or malign, especially unfairly or spitefully.
examples: […]  those cross-Atlantic aficionados who persistently idolize the British theater and bad-mouth Broadway.
